snippet: Rebel leaders announced on Saturday that they had appointed four key ministers from the Yemeni government they had overthrown, but Saudi Arabia and its allies denounced the plan.
abstract: Houthi rebels in Yemen appoint four government officials they had ousted to national security committee; Saudi Arabia denounces their plan for new government and calls on United National Security Council to step in.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SHUAIB ALMOSAWA

lead_paragraph: Rebel leaders announced on Saturday that they had appointed four key ministers from the Yemeni government they had overthrown, but Saudi Arabia and its allies denounced the plan.

headline.main: Saudis Unswayed by Houthi Rebels’ Overture in Yemen
